text: puddle was founded in 2006 we are a
worldwide leader in sports video
analysis I'm currently working on a
product called hull focus which is a
connected smart camera that installs in
gyms across the country to capture the
games uploading to huddle automatically
we're currently using AWS IOT device
management jobs to communicate back and
forth with the device you know it lets
us invoke actions on the device through
our mobile app we will start a job to
let you start recording stop recording
if somebody in support needs to diagnose
a device they can do remote reboots they
can do color calibrations and anything
that we want to expand upon that we can
all do through jobs device management is
really for monitoring the health and
status of our devices so we use shadow
States for configuring devices letting
them know which school they're
associated to how they can talk to
huddle what state they're in so if they
are ordered delivered activated awaiting
calibration that kind of stuff we use to
reach other states we had a high school
that was in our beta program and they do
volleyball and I think that is really
important to a team when they bought the
units the first game they had they also
have a live streaming crew that comes
into the gym the live streaming crew
actually unplugged the focus camera
before the event started because the
device was on IOT though it was able to
re-establish a connection once they
plugged it back in before the game
started and it automatically picked up
started recording and they didn't lose
any video because of that so as long as
the school has a reliable connection
it'll upload and be ready for playback
as soon as the game's done how about we
release software every week and we
release every new features and bug fixes
and improvements we want that stuff to
be on the device as soon as possible
that's where IOT comes in handy
